data.sampled: Yes, the word "arrenopos" does exist in Greek. It means "faceless." The correct spelling is άρρηνοπώς, which consists of three words: "arrhe," meaning faceless; "enos," meaning without; and "-pos," meaning suffix indicating nounness. The full etymology of the word can be broken down as follows: "Arr-he + enos (without) + -pos = Arrenopos". Note that the first letter should not be capitalized unless it is the beginning of a sentence, as it is used here to answer your question properly.
